fields.description:
Currently you can either turn a macro on or off for the entire confluence installation in the configuration files. It would be much better to be able to enable / disable macros on a page / space / global bases in the web interface.

Also a setting to stop this macro's state being changed in lower containers would be useful (eg: in the space set {html} off, and set is so that it cannot be activated at the page level, set the {anchor} macro on globally, but allow it to be turned off in spaces).
fields.summary: Macro Enable / Disable switches

fields.description:
Currently macro's like {html} can either be enabled fully or not at all. This request is for macro's to have runtime options which can be set at the global / space / page level to pass in variables for configuration. 

Using the {html} macro as an example - this is a dangerous macro but customisation at any could be used to secure what tags can / cannot be used inside the macro [eg: disable <script /> tags]. In some cases you might only want <table> based elements (tr,td,th etc) to be used in a documentation space when greater flexability than the simple wiki tables are needed.

If the allowed list is populated, ONLY those tags should be allowed, if the denied list is populated ANY tags except those listed should be allowed, if both lists are empty then all tags should be allowed (default behaviour).

The customisations / configurations should be allowed to inherit and override, inherit only, or replace unilatterally the configurations from the container above (eg: in the space set whether these configurations can be overriden / inherited by pages, and on a page set what you want to do [where allowed])
fields.summary: Macro Customisation at various levels

fields.description: Instead, it should have a header row that says 'Select Project' or similar.

fields.description:
I tried to create a page using macros {code} to put java code inside.
The page looked ok. Then I tried to generate the pdf or xml view and got an exception.

I think you tried to create a DOM using dom4j and put into DOM some of text as is without encoding the spetial (non XML) symbols like &.
fields.summary: Write XML with spetial symbols: &, <, >, etc

fields.description:
When using Radeox directly we never had any problems with things inside {code} blocks being interpreted as macros.

Unfortunately after moving to Confluence we've found all kinds of things break & have to be explicitly escaped. We really need a 'code block, no escapes required' macro.

e.g.

http://docs.codehaus.org/display/GROOVY/Regular+Expressions

we can't get this page to render, when it worked perfectly fine in Radeox. e.g. look for the =~ ==~ ~= symbols, they don't come out right in Confluence. Also the fonts go bizarre.
fields.summary: Shouldn't need to escape things inside {code}

fields.description: When doing the setup, the steps on the left-hand side are no longer ticked when they're completed.
fields.summary: Setup steps don't check any more

fields.description: Would like to have this function to recover the accidentally removed pages, like a recycle bin or recently removed pages list.

fields.description:
I've deployed the application as an exploded directory.  The log4j.properties files in WEB-INF/classes is not being read.

There is a log4j.configuration= directive in the server startup that may be conflict with it, but I'm not a log4j expert.  How is log4j being inited in the app?  Is is looking for a specific resource in the classpath or is it using the default mechanism?

Perhaps a way to override the default mechanism is in order?
fields.summary: Log4j.properties not being recognized in weblogic

fields.description:
Symptom: com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: The zip doesn't contain an 'entities.xml' file in it.

When backup files are zipped on Windows backslash is used as the path separator. These backslashes then cause Unix boxes to be unable to find files in the zip.

Backups created on Unix import into Windows with no problems.

Workaround: Unzip the backup file and re-create it with a tool that stores path separators as forward-slashes (the Linux command-line zip tools can do this)
fields.summary: Backups created on Windows can't restore on Unix.

fields.description:
I started out with Confluence using Win2000/Tomcat.  Things went well enough, but Linux is our standard server environment so I decided to move my spaces to a new Confluence instance running on Fedora/Tomcat.  

I backed up my 2000/Tomcat Confluence and then tried to restore it to the Fedora/Tomcat Confluence but got this error:

com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: The zip doesn't contain an 'entities.xml' file in it.

After digging around a little it occured to me to check the {confluence_data}/temp/ directory to see what the import folder looked like. To my surprise the zip backup created on 2000 expanded to something like:

\entities.xml
\exportDescriptor.properties
\shortcut-map.properties
\attachments\16\scm interaction.png


where the back slashes above *don't* represent path delimiters but do represent characters that are part of the file names.  So essentially instead of getting "entities.xml" the import folder ends up with "\entities.xml" 

I'm not sure if this is a know zip problem with Java on Windows and Linux.  

I went in and fixed up all the file names/directories, created a zip file on Linux and then the restore worked fine.
fields.summary: backups created on Windows won't restore on Linux

fields.description:
The {noformat} macro cannot be used inside table cells. This issue is somewhat related to CONF-790, where {noformat} couldn't be used in lists. The following example: || test | {noformat}foo{noformat} | is rendered as:
test 
foo
|

The {noformat} panel is displayed inside the table cell (as desired), but the actual content is rendered below the table.
fields.summary: noformat inside tables

fields.description: It would be very useful to show the incoming links on an exported page (pdf/html), as I find the "incoming links" a _very_ important feature of "networked knowledge" in a confluence based wiki.
fields.summary: Show incoming links on exported Pages

fields.description:
When exporting a page to HTML which includes others
eg:

{include:My Sub Page}


The page will not include the attachments on that sub page, nor will it adjust the links. 

Exporting of the space, and selecting the page and the included ones still does not work, as the image links point to /confluence/ rather than to the correct location on disk.

So when a page is included it needs to somehow include all the attachments and rewrite the image urls during export.
fields.summary: Export of page which includes other pages loses images

fields.description:
Someone here managed to cause the creation of two pages with the same name in one space. Both pages are shown in all listings for pages (as a child of the space home and as created by the {children} macro which incidentally lists these pages with the "create new page" action).

When trying to operate either one, the web interface claims the page does not exist and the following is printed to catalina.out:

com.atlassian.confluence.core.persistence.hibernate.HibernateObjectDao findSingleObject
SEVERE: Uh oh - found more than one object when single object requested: [com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Page@fd49f9[title=blah blah, full content of the page is printed here....

Unfortunately I don't have the exact steps on how to reproduce the problem. I'd love to be able to get rid of the pages though...
fields.summary: Duplicate pages with same name

fields.description:
Hi guys -

This is a minor minor point... but thought I would pass it on anyway.

If a page is created with a quote (e.g. Dion's Cool), and a child page is created... when you get to:

"<< make Dion's Cool the parent"

the JavaScript fails.  Looks like the ' isn't escaped to be \'.

Cheers,

Dion

fields.description:
We need the ability to add multiple files via a single zip. 

A single zip could be uploaded, it would then be unpacked into single files and become searchable.

Please note that we still need the ability to upload a zip that is not unpacked so don't override that function (a checkbox or seperate section perhaps).

An optional extra to this feature would be to add multiple (of a definable number) upload dialogs with a filebrowse function 

Stemming from my biggest pet hate to make lots of files searchable and accessable to other team members in a highly underresouced environment.
fields.summary: Ability to add multiple files

Excerpt from David Valentine Comment:

Ok. Maybe I can delete those users, but it's extremly slow, and causes the confluence webapp to be unavailable.

Slow deleting a user that has no pages (amy) took 8+ minutes for the confirming delete to appear, about as long for delete.
Pegging one CPU. Plenty of memory (87MB of 149MB) according to Jira.

I'm currently using Jira User management for supporting all the users.  It works fine except I noticed that the digest email that get sents states that a user who changed their profile (I know they changed it because I walked them through it) was a user added to the site.

It should correctly state that the user has been updated.

fields.description:
Can't create a link to things like...

irc://irc.codehaus.org/groovy

e.g.

[IRC|irc://irc.codehaus.org/groovy]

comes out as text, rather than as a link. Any workaround?
fields.summary: Can't generate hrefs to IRC

fields.description:
All space default homes have page title "Confluence - Home". Especially when using tabbed browsing, this slows down browsing a Confluence instance since the browser tabs/window listings don't identify the individual pages. Also having the word "Confluence" as the first thing in the title is rather application-centric UI design for a content-centric application. ;)

I propose the following:

1) Move "Confluence" to the end of the page title OR remove it altogether (as with JIRA)
2) Make the space key the first thing in the title (example: "DOC - Blah Blah" )
fields.summary: Confusing page titles

fields.summary: Remote API permissions not respecting "superuser" group

fields.summary: Make explicit "Publish space(s) as HTML to a directory" feature

fields.description:
At first glance this idea may sound a little out there, but I think it could be a very radical and innovative feature.

We've started using Confluence to publish/manage our software development design process.  We create pages for features, attach design documents, invite conversation and discussion over features.  Most of this conversation happens over email.  We have a email list full of people/stakeholders who need to sign-off on specifications or at least participate in the discussions about them.  

The most important topics and conversations happen over this email list.  This is a very important asset to us.  It would be very cool if there was a feature to include this information, these emails in Confluence.  

There are a few ways I thought of doing this.  Perhaps require that that a Confluence descriptor be used in the title or text of the email.  Something like "@Space/Page" in the email title and Confluence would archive the email in that page.  This would also assume Confluence is monitoring some email address.  The Confluence page would have a threaded email listing much like any other email archive.  

I know this probably seems a little out there, but I think that the result could be very powerful.  Imagine going to a page to see a new feature, then being able to click on a link like "Email Discussions" and see the dialog that brought that new feature into being.
fields.summary: Radical idea, archive external email in Confluence

fields.description:
It would be great to have a macro that lists eacy permission group and then each user for a particular permission.  

For example

View Space
- Group A
- - Joe Blow
- - Jane Doe
- Group B
- - Stan Man
- - Bill Dill
Modify Space
- Group A
- - Joe Blow
- - Jane Doe
- San Man

etc.


Only administrators can see who belongs to which group (we're using Jira as the security store).
fields.summary: Display ACL macro

fields.description:
It should be possible to restrict the visibility of user profiles (home pages). I.e. different customers should not have any idea about accounts of other customers. Now the links to profiles are shown for example in the "Recently Updated" list.

The permission administration could be implemented in the same way as in the spaces.
fields.summary: Permissions for user profiles

fields.description:
The SnipSnap importer only turns old-style SnipSnap blog posts to Confluence blog posts.

In SnipSnap 0.4.x, blog post URLS look like: 

http://host:port/space/2003-11-26

The equivalent in the exported snip file is

<snip>
<name>2003-11-26</name>
...

In the newer version of SnipSnap (since 0.5 I think - can't find a definitive description in the SnipSnap docs), blog posts go in with an URL like:

http://host:port/space/2003-11-26/1

Where there is one snip per post (instead of one per day). Multiple posts on the same day are called /1, /2, /3 etc.

In the snip export they look like

<snip>
<name>start/2003-11-26/1</name>

It is this second type of blog post that isn't turned into a Confluence blog post.

My particular import case has both old and new blog post types.
fields.summary: SnipSnap import only converts old-style (pre v0.5.x) blog posts properly

fields.description:
We have a requirement to publish project documentation in non-HTML formats such as MS Project files, Excel spreadsheets, etc. etc. We also have a requirement to version these files. While we can add them as attachments to a Confluence page, they are not versioned. There is an issue requesting versioning for attachments (CONF-527) but I think it would be better to add the ability to upload a non-HTML document as a "page" in Confluence.

For example, the "add page" and "add child page" commands would have variants to "upload page" or "upload child page". After clicking on the link, Confluence would prompt me to enter the path to the doc on my local drive. After entering the location (perhaps with a comment) and submitting, Confluence would create a "shell" page that displays the comment and a link to the actual document. Clicking on the "edit page" link on the "shell" would allow me to change the comment or upload a new version of the doc.
fields.summary: Create non-HTML child pages

fields.summary: Have an emergency "revert theme" option for when template is broken

fields.description:
Unicode page names look fine when first entered, but when you attempt to edit a page with a Japanese (or any non-ASCII name) the encoding gets screwed up and the name is garbled.  The same problem occurs when trying to add an attachment to a page with a non-ASCII name.

To Recreate:
1. Go to the dashboard
2. Click "New Page" icon
3. Enter a non-ASCII name (example: 日本語)
4. Click "Add"
5. Click "Edit"

The page name is now garbled.
fields.summary: Double Byte (Japanese) Page Title Becomes Obfuscated When Edited

fields.description:
Just a thought for a way to boost Confluence's sales. 

How about having a free 'personal edition' which comes in a simple to install, only runs on local host, Confluence system which allows folks to use Confluence as a personal documentation system for todo-lists, ideas, thoughts, proofing blog posts etc.

If I had Confluence on my laptop for example I can imagine using it all the time for notes, things I should do, personal ideas and so forth. 

Then this could act as a loss-leader, get folks hooked on it so they get their pointy haired bosses to buy it at their day jobs when working with teams?
fields.summary: have a free personal edition (localhost only)?

fields.description:
Its pretty neat having a 'tip of the day' pop up when you're using an app. It'd be really cool to use Confluence to write these, as child pages inside a TipOfTheDay page.

Then all we'd need is a simple little macro, not unlike the blog post macro - but which just renders a random child page.

Then we'd be able to submit tips of the day and then include them inside a home page every time someone go's to the home page.

Neat eh? It'd be cool for us all to adopt this on all our projects / products.
fields.summary: 'tip of the day' macro

fields.description:
In Radeox I'm used to being able to do

    [description|anyLink]

e.g.

    [FAQ|/foo/bar/whatnot.html]

while spaces are all linked, when linking to maven-generated stuff it'd be nice to not have to use the full host name. Then we'll be able to share common pages across projects (e.g. QuickLinks could be standard on all maven projects).

e.g. we could use standard links like

 [javadoc|/maven/apidocs/index.html]

which would work on any project's website, irrespective of the host name. Right now I have to use

 [javadoc|http://someproject.codehaus.org/maven/apidocs/index.html]
fields.summary: how to create relative site hrefs?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1107].
  {panel}

creating FAQs via child pages is neat. (e.g.

http://activemq.codehaus.org/FAQ

however when looking at the pages in a space, it'd be nice to show the hierarchy, rather than just a flat list. Any way to enable this?

e.g.

http://docs.codehaus.org/pages/listpages.action?key=ACTIVEMQ

there's no easy way to see the pages included inside of the FAQ page etc.

I'd like it to be more visually obvious of how to add to FAQ entries. (Maybe its just my pilot error?). Though I think TimTam shows this anyways - so whenever TimTam works on OS X I might have a workaroudn

e.g. when I've 100 FAQ entries in different categories, I'd like to be able to see this visually in the page list view
fields.summary: show space/page hierarchies in the page view?

fields.description:
it would be cool to be able to view the wiki source for any page in any space - whether you've edit rights or not.

Often you see a page and wonder how to wiki-format like it.

e.g. this one

http://docs.codehaus.org/display/TIMTAM/News

I wanna know how to do that! :)

I've found myself seeing nice pages in other spaces and just wanting to cut-n-paste the magic wiki-malarkey. Would a 'view wiki source' type link be reasonable to add by default?
fields.summary: Provide a 'view as source' link when navigating wikis

fields.description: This will make things *so* much easier to manage things like codehaus. It'll be another good sales reason why JIRA & Confluence should be used together since they can reuse the same user/roles stuff.
fields.summary: allow shared login / group / roles across JIRA and Confluence

fields.description:
When a user is deactivated, they are removed from all groups and stripped of all permissions (sot that they can't do anything meaningful anymore). 

Therefore they should not appear in the add permissions page where it is still currently possible to grant them user based permissions.
fields.summary: Deactivated users should not show up in the add permissions page

fields.description: they should be hidden and only shown with strikethrough font when the users selects "show deactivated users"
fields.summary: Deactivated users show up in manage users

fields.description:

Hi Mike,

The global RSS feed seems to have a rogue closing parenthesis ")" at  the 
end of each link..
http://opensource.atlassian.com/confluence/spring/globalrss.action

Obviously clicking on such a link in an RSS aggregator throws up a 
confluence application error.  Doesn't seem to affect any other RSS link 
from what I can see.

fields.description:
The 404 'page not found' error page dies rather messily under PostgreSQL because the database does not like the 'find pages that used to have this name' query.

The quick workaround for Postgresql users is to copy the attached ContentEntityObject.hbm.xml over the existing file in the Confluence installation, and restart the server.
fields.summary: 404 page dies under Postgresql

fields.description:
This bug prevents users from being able to edit any pages. Attempting to do so results in a blank page. 

To fix this problem we recommend upgrading to 1.0.2 which is now available for download at: 

http://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/ConfluenceDownloadCenter.jspa

If upgrading is not an option you can try a workaround submitted by Paul Rene Jorgensen: 

In the tomcat directory go to: webapps/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/c
om/atlassian/confluence

Edit the file: default.properties

and change the date to something in the future.

eg. "build.date=Mar 12, 2004" to "build.date=Apr 12, 2004"
makes it last another month. Restart tomcat.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1093].
  {panel}

Currently the list of supported Syntax Highlightings in the \{code} macro are limited, and will require to be altered as the support languages develop (eg: to include Generics in Java 1.5).

It is suggested that the highlighting rules, regular expressions and word lists be made dynamic - pulling from configuration files (xml prefered). This way languages can be added and altered by end users and atlassian alike. Programs like Edit Plus / TextPad already do this, in their own way - and import / conversion routines would be nice too (saves redefinition).

Finally, at the last phase Armond suggests to open the interface to the users either to directly define their syntax highlighting format via web UI or to import from the already existed ones!

[Issue Creation recommended by Armond Avanes in related issue CONF-893]
fields.summary: User Defined Syntax Highlighting

fields.description:
Only every other paragraph is marked with surrounding

tags. This results in browsers rendering every other paragraph using the Confluence stylesheet's definition for a "paragraph" class and every other using the default settings. On some browsers, this results in the use of two different font sizes for body text of pages. For example, in the following page all three paragraphs are rendered together with the first and the third paragraph being surrounded by

's and the middle one just being nested in the middle. http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEST/Paragraph+rendering+demo
fields.summary: Wrong paragraph markup
